revised_title: Determination of Air Viscosity Using Torsionally Vibrating Wires
tldr: The authors investigate the coefficient of viscosity of air using a torsionally vibrating wire apparatus. They find that the loss of energy from air friction can be characterized as the dragging of the air, and the results show a close agreement with previous methods. The mean value of the coefficient of viscosity of air obtained is 0.00017746 at a temperature of 12.650 °C.
